org.mxupdate.util
Class JPOHandler_mxJPO

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.util.JPOHandler_mxJPO

public class JPOHandler_mxJPO
extends Object

The classes handles the source code conversion from "standard" Java classes to source code which could be understand by MX.

Version:
$Id: JPOHandler_mxJPO.java 593 2009-10-19 07:31:58Z tim.moxter $
Author:
The MxUpdate Team

Nested Class Summary
 class JPOHandler_mxJPO.ClassFile
          The class is used to hold the definition of one class file.

File name and file extension together.

See Also:
evaluateFiles(File, File), Constant Field Values

PATTERN_PACKAGE

private static final Pattern PATTERN_PACKAGE
Regular expression for the package line. The package must be removed from the JPO because Matrix does internally handle all JPOs within the default package.

See Also:
JPOHandler_mxJPO.ClassFile.getCode()

PATTERN_IMPORT

private static final Pattern PATTERN_IMPORT
Regular expression for the import statement of JPOs.

See Also:
JPOHandler_mxJPO.ClassFile.getCode()

PATTERN_JPOWITHOUTPCK

private static final Pattern PATTERN_JPOWITHOUTPCK
Regular expression for a JPO name without a package (but in the front a package is defined). The expression is used to extract the JPO class name from the import definition.

See Also:
JPOHandler_mxJPO.ClassFile.getCode()

PATTERN_JPO

private static final Pattern PATTERN_JPO
Regular expression for a referenced JPO within the Java source code.

See Also:
JPOHandler_mxJPO.ClassFile.getCode()

jpoMap

private final Map<String,JPOHandler_mxJPO.ClassFile> jpoMap
Map between the JPO name and the related class file instance.

Map depending on the package name and the related JPO name.

mapPckLocalNames

Holds the maps for each package depending on the class name and the related complete class name including the package.

evaluateFiles

protected void evaluateFiles(File _rootPath,
                             File _packagePath)
Parameters:
_rootPath - path of the root (where the JPO code is located)
_packagePath - path of the package depending on the root path

evaluatePackage

protected void evaluatePackage()
For each package the related set of JPOs is stored. They are needed to identify local defined Java classes.

See Also:
